DOC.brief_summary: The combined use of a mosquito repellent and long lasting insecticidal nets (LLINs) by household members would result in a 40% reduction in malaria prevalence compared with households that only use LLINs.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of a Combined Use of Mosquito Repellent and Insecticide Treated Net on Malaria in Ethiopia
DOC.detailed_description: It has been recognized that the use of malaria preventive measures in combination with LLINs could improve the effectiveness of nets in preventing the disease. This study examined the effect of a combined use of mosquito repellent (i.e., Buzz Off) and LLINs on malaria prevalence in an area of unstable and seasonal malaria transmission.
DOC.criteria: All volunteer household members Infants less than two months Not in the study area
